newsitem.title: JAPAN: Oriental Land related issues rise in morning.
newsitem.headline: Oriental Land related issues rise in morning.

text.p: Issues related to the listing of Tokyo Disneyland operator Oriental Land Co Ltd rose on Wednesday morning, encouraged by media reports saying it will be listed early as December, brokers said.
At 0110 GMT, Keisei Electric Railway Co Ltd shares were up 30 yen at 1,170 yen with 2.757 million shares traded, the second most heavily traded issue on the first section of the Tokyo Stock Exchange.
Mitsui Fudosan Co Ltd shares were up 10 yen at 1,460 yen with a trade of 1.003 million, ranking 11th in terms of volume.
Keisei Electric and Mitsui Fudosan are both shareholders of Oriental Land.

The economic daily Nihon Keizai Shimbun said that at the time of the listing, 23 million to 25 million Oriental Land shares will be sold on the market. This would include 15 million to 18 million new shares which will be issued to boost the company's capital, the paper said.
Oriental Land officials were not immediately available for comment on the report.
